description: Whisky Thief is an innovative bourbon from Indiana. Aged in new American-oak barrels with charred oak inserts, which increases the speed of maturation. Fruity and spicy with notes of vanilla and mocha.

whiskeyName: Jack Daniel's Old No.7 Half Bottle
description: A half bottle of Jack Daniel's best selling old no.7 Tennessee Whiskey, famous worldwide thanks to the sweet smoothness imparted by the Lincoln County Process of charcoal-mellowing the spirit before maturation.
Medium-bodied, yet intensely flavoured, with a strong blast of spice amid the dark sugar and vanilla notes. "Magnificent stuff from Heaven Hill that really is worth hunting for." Jim Murray

whiskeyName: Rebel Yell Small Batch Reserve Bourbon
description: Immortalised by Billy Idol in the 1980s, Rebel Yell is a classic bourbon, deservedly famous for its quality as well as its rock-star associations. The Small Batch Reserve has notes of vanilla, rye spice and caramel.
One of the rising stars in the premium bourbon market, with a growing following in the UK due to its distinctive looks and exceptional quality.

whiskeyName: Jim Beam Double Oak Gift Box
description: Launched in 2016, Jim Beam Double Oak is aged in in not one, but two, new charred-oak barrels. This has all the classic sweetness and flavours of Jim Beam White Label, but with added spice.

A devilish twist on Jim Beam's regular bourbon, blending their 6 year old whiskey with spirit extracted from the wood of the cask itself, where it's soaked in over the years of maturation. This gives us a robust and hefty bourbon with a nice added chunk of woody richness.
Very popular bourbon, aged a minimum of five years in oak barrels for extra smoothness and carefully blended for a consistently smooth, creamy flavour.
A corn spirit entirely devoid of colour (but not of flavour!) due to an ageing period guaranteed less than 30 days! A treat for any drinker who thinks they've tried everything.
A well priced bourbon that punches above its weight. Evan Williams 1783 is named for the year that the eponymous Welsh emigré started distilling near Louisville, Kentucky.
A four-year-old straight bourbon produced by Jim Beam at their distillery in Clermont, Kentucky. This young bourbon is versatile and can either be drunk neat, as part of a long drink or in cocktails.

whiskeyName: Jim Beam White Label and 2 Glasses Gift Pack
description: Jim Beam White Label has been made to the same formula since 1795 and is aged for four years in oak barrels to create a smooth, mellow taste with hints of spice. It is presented here with a pair of glasses.

whiskeyName: Buffalo Trace White Dog Mash 1 Half Bottle
description: The fad for distilleries releasing their new make spirit continues, this time in the form of Buffalo Trace's 'White Dog', the affectionate name given to unaged whiskey. Competitively-priced and attractively packaged, we reckon that Buffalo Trace's extra style credentials could well see this becoming a hit cocktail ingredient.

An 81 proof (40.5%ABV) bourbon crafted by Wild Turkey associate distiller Eddie Russell, son of master distiller Jimmy. It's a high rye mash matured in heavily charred casks for big flavour at a more approachable ABV than the 101.

Rebel Yell is made at the Heaven Hill distillery in Kentucky. Immortalised by Billy Idol in the 1980s, Rebel Yell is a classic bourbon, deservedly famous for its quality as well as its rock-star associations. Big and bold with notes of honey, butter and a touch of spice on the finish.

whiskeyName: Jim Beam White Label Gift Box
description: Jim Beam White Label has been mMade to the same formula since 1795. This giant of the category is aged for four years in oak barrels to create a smooth, mellow taste with hints of spice.

This bourbon was first produced in Bardstown, Kentucky, in 1935, just two years after the end of Prohibition. An extremely approachable American whiskey with appealing notes of vanilla and sweet spices. Serve neat or on the rocks.
The flagship brand produced by the Heaven Hill distillery in Kentucky. A solid 4 year old bourbon.
Early Times is a Kentucky bourbon from the Brown-Forman portfolio. With a high percentage of corn in the blend, Old Reserve is light and sweet with rich caramel notes.

McAfee's Benchmark is a rye-recipe Kentucky straight bourbon from the Buffalo Trace distillery, awarded 90 points by Wine Enthusiast and a former Gold Medal and Trophy winner at the International Spirits Challenge.

A terrific small-batch bourbon from Four Roses – and in this case, Small Batch means just that – only four casks are used in the construction of each release. Sweet and spicy, with a generous dash of vanilla, this is a treat.

whiskeyName: Jim Beam Red Stag Black Cherry
description: A love-it-or-hate-it whiskey from Jim Beam, who have flavoured their bourbon with natural cherry flavour to make Red Stag.

whiskeyName: Junior Johnson's Midnight Moon Raspberry Moonshine
description: The Johnson family has been making moonshine for 150 years. It has endured Prohibition, the odd brush with the law and Junior Johnson himself has even received a presidential pardon. Produced using a five-step filtration process, Midnight Moonshine contains raspberries soaked in 45% moonshine made from American corn. Try with ice and lemonade for a refreshing long drink.

whiskeyName: Tipplesworth Old Fashioned Mini Cocktail Kit
description: A quirky kit containing all you need to put together the perfect Old Fashioned – considered by many to be the original cocktail. A 5cl bottle of Woodford Reserve Bourbon, 2cl of Tipplesworth's own sugar syrup, a tiny bottle of Angostura bitters and cocktail stirrer come with a stylish tin and a recipe to make sure you get the best out of your ingredients.

whiskeyName: Jack Daniel's Old No.7 Half Bottle
description: A half bottle of Jack Daniel's best selling old no.7 Tennessee Whiskey, famous worldwide thanks to the sweet smoothness imparted by the Lincoln County Process of charcoal-mellowing the spirit before maturation.

whiskeyName: Jack Daniel's Old No. 7 Small Bottle
description: A 20cl bottle of world-famous Jack Daniel's old no. 7. The same familiar taste and quality, just easier to carry on the move.
Launched in 2016, Jim Beam Double Oak is aged in in not one, but two, new charred-oak barrels. This has all the classic sweetness and flavours of Jim Beam White Label, but with added spice.

whiskeyName: Junior Johnson's Midnight Moon Blueberry Moonshine
description: A high-strength, unaged spirit infused with blueberries. This was distilled from 100% American corn and undergoes a five-step filtration process, resulting in an ultra-smooth and clean-tasting drink.

A solid bourbon produced by, strangely, the folks of the Florida Caribbean Distilling company. They make rum and other spirits at their distillery in Florida, but this is made in Kentucky and selected by the company.
The extra aged version of Evan Williams's solid sipping whiskey, one of the biggest sellers in the USA beind the similar looking Old No. 7.
An unaged corn whiskey from Firefly Moonshine on Wadmalaw Island, South Carolina, White Lightning comes in the traditional jar.
Packaged in an old-style bottle, Bulleit whiskey has developed a loyal following in the UK. The high rye content (around 30%) gives this bourbon a spicy kick.
From the ever-dependable Wild Turkey operation comes one of the best straight rye whiskies around. Now at a new strength of 40.5%.
Made to one of Beam's oldest recipes, this release of rye whiskey is made in a pre-Prohibition style. Big, bold and spicy with notes of vanilla and black pepper.

The original all-conquering cola-friendly colossus, Jack Daniel's No. 7 commands a legion of fans worldwide, thanks to the sweet smoothness imparted by the Lincoln County Process of charcoal-mellowing the spirit before maturation.

Buffalo Trace is a really classy bourbon from the eponymous distillery that has been responsible for some truly outstanding products in recent years. A must-stock for any bar worthy of the name and probably the best all-rounder at the price
A Prohibition-style white-dog spirit from the UK, packed full of flavour despite its clarity – great as a cocktail ingredient or sipped.
Made to the same formula since 1795, this giant of the category is aged for four years in oak barrels to create a smooth, mellow taste with hints of spice.

whiskeyName: Jim Beam Black 6 Year Old Triple Aged
description: Jim Beam Black, the 'triple-aged' statement refers not to three different types of cask (as that would not be allowed under bourbon regulations) but to the 6 year old age statement, which is three times the minimum maturation period for straight bourbon.

Mellow Corn is a high-proof gold-coloured American corn whisky. As a corn whiskey, the mashbill is a minimum of 81% corn, with the remainder being a combination of malted barley and rye. A light, sweet whiskey, perfect for summer evenings.
